alert.note: Alert for Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 10 at 7:25PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Sumner County through 800 PM CDT... At 725 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Geuda Springs, or 11 miles west of Arkansas City, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Sumner County. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
